page.title: 12QUEEN ETHELBURGA'S SCHOOL
page.content: This private girl's school was built in 1910 and its grounds cover about 30 acres.There are 13 classrooms and rooms for Art,Music,Science and computer studies.The girls can be day girls or boarders and come from all over the world.It costs Â£1,400 a term for boarders and between Â£600 and Â£800 a term for day pupils.Boarders live in seperate houses, in rooms divided into cubicles.In the senior school there are 204 pupils aged 11 to 18,a head teacher, 15 fulltime and 10 part-time teachers.There is now a Junior School for primary age children.The school day begins at 8.55am with assembly in the chapel and ends at 4.05pm.There are nine lessons in a day lasting 35 minutes each.After tea there is an hours homework for boarders.Uniform is a brown skirt,white shirt,brown tie and fawn jumper.
